inn1.comm: Mpofu beings with a length ball that shapes away a touch, defended to cover
fuller, swinging away, starts middle and leg, shapes towards off, pushed back to Hafeez
slightly shorter, shaping away again, Hafeez defends off the back foot
slightly slower delivery, on a length, around off, pushed back to Mpofu
the first error in line, and Hafeez flicks this away off the pads for a single
short of a length, around off, angling away, defended to cover
short of a length, quick delivery, pushed to cover
no turn, angling into the pads, hits the pad on the way to short fine
goes back to work this straight delivery to square leg
flat outside off, back-cuts it, can't beat point
the first flighted delivery, defended off the front foot
Price starts with a maiden... this is angled into the pads too, worked away to square leg

Farhat's return to international cricket has lasted two balls. It has ended through a poor shot. This is short, not too wide, but he cuts away from the body. Slight movement away, slight extra bounce, the edge taken. Price and Mpofu get into their unique dancing celebrations where they knock each other's heels
Mpofu digs this first ball in. Younis defends this in front of his chest
Younis starts off well, stands tall and drives from the crease. Off the middle of the bat, wide of cover, along the ground
Mpofu bowls this wide down the leg side and lets out a groan in disappointment
slower ball, full on middle and off, defended back
slight swing away for Mpofu, Younis defends with an open face, past point
slower ball again, on a length, around off, defended off the front foot
Zimbabwe nearly get another! Younis looks to flick this to leg, is early into the shot, gets a thick leading edge that just about beats Taylor at short extra
Hafeez is solid in defence, plays this to short cover
flat and straight, defended back to Price
a touch too straight, Hafeez sweeps, misses and is hit on the pads
sees Hafeez step out and fires this into the pads. Padded away
slightly slower, more towards middle and off, defended back to Price
a really nice bouncer, it is not too short to start off with, and then it kicks off towards the throat. Younis doesn't take his eyes off it, and defends in front of his face
MPofu is excited, and bowls another bouncer, which would surely have been a no-ball had it not bounced over his head to be called a wide
lovely comeback from Younis, plants the front foot down expecting a full ball, and drives this sweetly between the bowler and the non-striker
length ball outside off, defended with an open face towards point
short of a length, worked away nicely past short fine, and they push for the second run and eventually get it
The hours he spent on the crease in the Test are showing. Mpofu is slightly too straight, and Younis is well forward again, and clips it for four past square leg
cuts this solidly too, but can't get it past point
angled into the pads, worked away fine, but can't beat short fine leg
goes wide of the crease, again angles it into the pads, Hafeez fails to connect on the sweep
into the pads again, no turn, pushed to short midwicket
Price has frustrated Hafeez into playing this adventurous premeditated sweep. It takes his top edge onto the arm and then through for a single to the right of short fine
tossed up slightly, worked wide of mid-on for one
quicker, pushed through, Hafeez looks to pull but this is not short enough, and he manages a mis-hit towards midwicket
Younis is not wasting any deliveries, he is not hitting any fielders, just the gaps. Pushes this wide of point, and takes another single
lovely shot from Hafeez too... length ball outside off, he just meets it with a slightly open face, and the superb timing takes it for three runs between mid-off and extra cover
Younis finds the gap again, pushing this shortish delivery to the right of midwicket
Hafeez defends this length ball off the front foot, straight towards cover
another length ball, just outside off, defended off the front foot
looks for the tip-and-run, but has timed this well towards point so they decide against the single
finally Younis finds a fielder, works this with Price's angle but can't place it past short midwicket
pushes this to mid-off, on the walk, and exploits the deep positioning of mid-off
Hafeez is getting frustrated here... tries the reverse-sweep now, but can't beat point
fired into the pads, and finds square leg this time
Hafeez gets one for the sweep, but hits it straight to square leg, where a fumble allows them the single
Younis punches this wide of square leg for another single
short of a length, outside off, dabs this down to point
length ball on the pads, and mercilessly whipped away by Younis, beating deep square leg
lovely batting from Younis... the non-boundary balls he is placing for singles... this one he hits softly to mid-off and charges through for one - 26 off 20 without a ball hit in anger
Hafeez has run straight down the wicket here! Pushes this to mid-on, and rushes for one, straight on the stump-to-stump line
more from Younis... short ball, into the body, and he half-pulls-half-glances this between the keeper and short fine leg
Younis can't do anything wrong today... there are four men in the circle on the off side, and he has threaded them with this extra-cover drive
Hafeez tries to manufacture something again, charging at Price. This time the mis-hit gets a single to long-on
angled into the pads, worked away to square leg
placed between square leg and midwicket for one
similar delivery no the pads, but Hafeez finds the fielder at square leg
gives this one some air, and Hafeez defends off the front foot
sweeps powerfully, but can't beat the man at square leg
flighted around off, driven powerfully to long-on for one
played with the turn, straight to square leg
another push finds the fielder, midwicket this time
pushed to cover
driven against the turn, finds cover
goes wide of the crease to bowl this offbreak, defended back to him
drives a full delivery to long-on for one
places this wide of midwicket and charges through for one
the straighter one outside off, tries the late-cut, can't beat point
soon as he some flight, Younis presses forward and drives this to long-on
the straighter one again, and the late-cut finds point
Hafeez finally finds a gap on the sweep. This one is played from outside off, and is placed to the right of square leg. Badly needed boundary for Hafeez
driven down to long-on for a single
plays the paddle this time, gets a single
shimmies down the track, beaten in the flight, but still places this wide of midwicket
slower through the air, Hafeez finds out he is not quite to the pitch of it, defends this back
driven with an open face, Taylor misfields at cover to allow a bonus run
Younis is down the track again, drives this to deep midwicket for a single
Younis keeps finding the gaps, this is short and wide, and he rocks back and cuts it between point and cover-point
short of a length, punched away straight to short midwicket, lets out a groan after finding the fielder
tossed up outside off, gets some turn, and beats him, hitting him on the pad outside the line of off
worked away with the turn, past square leg for one
cut away from in front of off, Utseya makes a diving save at point to keep them down to one
worked away off the front foot, past square leg for one
another drive off the pads, gets a single to deep midwicket
Hafeez opens up. No need to find gaps when you can time them so well. Clears the front leg, gets a full delivery, and lofts it inside-out, over long-off
another superb shot, shimmies down the track and lofts this straight over the bowler's head. There is a long-on in place, but he can't get around in time

the sweep and that square leg fielder get the better of Hafeez. All day Hafeez has kept sweeping straight to that man. This time he fails to keep it down, and Sibanda takes a sharp catch at square leg
gets an offbreak on the pads, can't place it wide of square leg
a fumble by the diving straight midwicket allows Misbah to get off the mark
Misbah reverse-sweeps the third ball he faces... always knew he wanted to do this to this length ball outside off, guides it fine of short third man
worked away off the pads, gets a single past square leg

long hop and Younis is in no mood to let these go unpunished. Pulls this smack in between the two men deep on the on side. Brings up a lovely fifty, and has an ear-to-ear smile on. It is anyway difficult to find him not smiling
full now, and he has found midwicket with this flick
another long hop, this time Younis pulls it in the air, but again bisects the deep men on the on side
works this length ball past short fine leg to keep strike for the next over
flighted on middle and leg, placed wide of midwicket for another single
another tossed-up delivery, driven to long-on for a single
overpitched on the pads, driven to long-on again. Misbah wanted the second, but was sent back
length ball on the pads, defended towards midwicket
full on the pads, paddled away to short fine
turning into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket for a single
and the first loose shot from Younis. This is on a length, wide outside off, Younis drives, expecting it to angle in, but the ball holds its line and beats the outside edge
this time Younis doesn't drive, just opens the face on it to get a single past point
Misbah defends with an open face, can't beat point
length ball outside off, driven on the up, but can't beat mid-off
worked away off the pads, gets a single past square leg
wide length ball, Younis reaches for it, and drives it to sweeper-cover
a length ball into the pads, flicked away for a single
straying down leg again, Misbah misses out on an easy single
short of a length, pushed to point off the back foot
punched to mid-off, wants the single, then realises he has hit it too well and straight to the man
angling into the pads, placed smack between the two deep men on the on side, but Misbah doesn't want the second and sends Younis back. fair enough. It is Misbah's call
pushed to long-on for yet another single
presses forward and drives this length ball to long-on
wide outside off, Misbah doesn't time the punch well, finds point
length ball, angling in, Misbah gets a soft inside edge, and they steal a single
the second loose shot by Younis. Trying to chase one short one outside off, and it holds its line, and beats the outside edge. Lets out a grunt
hit to cover, a slight fumble there, and Younis tells Misbah "woh humari tarah hai" [he is like us]. Misbah responds "haan dheela hai' [yes, he is slow]
driven to long-on for a single
drives off the front foot, can't beat midwicket
this of fuller, and easily driven down the ground to long-on
slightly short, and he has pulled this down the ground for a single to long-on
short of a length, another misfield from Zimbabwe. Chigumbura this time at midwicket. Doesn't get low down. The ball sneaks through. Costs them a single
worked past midwicket this time for another single
driven on the up, the mid-off is too deep to prevent the single
pitched up outside off, driven straight to mid-off
slightly short of a length, pushed off the front foot, finds cover
looks to play this down the ground, but Chigumbura makes a diving save on the right to keep the single down
short of a length, wide outside off, Younis drives with an open face, straight to point. I think this is the most number of dots he has faced in a row today
another push into the off side finds a fielder. "Still no," shouts Younis
digs this one in short, and Younis pulls this off the front foot, wide of midwicket for a single
on the up, and uppish too, just eludes Masakadza. This is hit over the umpires' head, and firmly too, and Masakadza can't get a hand to it in his follow-through
punched away to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, too full, driven between cover and point
driven sightly wide of midwicket, and they rush through for another single. A slight fumble from Chigumbura helped
overpitched, middle and off, driven to long-on for one
another single to long-on - six singles off the over
Chigumbura is doing well with the ones straightening outside off, Misbah leaves the bat hanging outside off, the edge is taken, and it goes fine
fuller, closer to off, pushed to long-on for a single
sees Younis step down the track, bowls short of a length, punched back to the bowler

close lbw shout. Younis has moved well across, and misses a straight delivery. Gould says nut out, although Younis has a guilty look on his face. The only thing that could have saved him here is if the ball had hit him outside off. It has hit him in front of off. Younis lucky to still be there
another single to long-on
length ball, angling in, defended towards midwicket
Younis gives him the charge right away and drives him to long-on for one
wide of the crease, turning into the pads, pushed between square leg and midwicket for one
Younis is making up for those five dots a couple of overs ago. Gives him the charge again, but also opens the stance a bit so that he can loft it over midwicket. First boundary since the 16th over

Has Younis run himself out? Yes he has . This is hit wide of deep midwicket, and Younis stutters before starting for the second. Waller's throw is flat and quick, and even a dive from Younis is not good enough. They didn't run the first one fast, and were never too keen on the second until -without a hint of disagreement - they both decided to go for the second. Younis had just survived a plumb lbw call in the last over
and he charges down the wicket first ball, pushing this offbreak to long-on for one
worked around the corner, but not past short fine leg
length ball around off, pushed to cover
jumps out of the crease again, dug in short, worked away off the hip for one
steered away to third man for one
outside the crease again, Chibhabha makes a full-length diving save at short midwicket

Taibu has pulled off a blinder, and another comeback man has failed! This will rad as a wicket for the bowler, but it is all down to Taibu. He saw this ball sliding down leg, and moved exceptionally early in anticipation. Malik got a thick edge down the leg side, and Taibu flew across to his left to pouch this one-handed. Smart and athletic both at the same time
another one holds its line outside off, defended off the outside half of the bat
driven back towards the non-striker. Utseya dives in front of him
too full, placed between midwicket and square leg for one
Akmal dances down the track and pushes this down to long-on for one
placed just to the right of midwicket, soft hands, and they get a single
full, into the pads, clipped straight to midwicket
flatter, quicker, defended to midwicket
Zimbabwe's fielding continues to be inconsistent. Poor work by Taylor at extra cover. Driven on the up towards him, and he has let it straight through his hands
this one jags back in, gets an inside edge, but misses the stumps
lovely bowling, a near legcutter on account of its holding its line outside off, beats the edge
and again he has Akmal pushing at a length ball outside off, and then gets it to straighten and beat the edge. It's the angle from wide of the crease that is making him play
this time Akmal gets bat on ball, guiding this to point
holds its line again, Akmal gets a thick outside edge for a single to third man
worked away off the pads for a single
the paddle sweep now, gets a single to long leg
leaves the crease, Utseya throws it up higher, pushed down to long-on for one
long hop, but it stays low, and Misbah doesn't play the full-blooded pull. Still gets a single to deep midwicket
Umar loves to cut the spinner as he does this ball just short of a length
pushed down the ground off the back foot, gets another single
Akmal wants a single off the misfield at point, but Misbah sends him back
drives this fuller delivery to long-on for one
length ball outside off, Akmal defends off the back foot
short of a length, clipped to midwicket with the angle
Chgiumbur beats the outside edge again, this is a lovely spell from him. Again the ball straightens outside off, and Akmal ends up driving inside its line
angled into the pads, Akmal can't beat square leg with the slip
length ball, straying into the pads, worked away for an easy single
comes forward to drive this length ball to mid-off
dabs this length ball square with an open face, but hits it straight to point
Akmal finally gets going with a lovely inside-out drive. He is out of the crease, clears the front leg to make room, and then lofts him over extra cover
short ball outside off, opens the face late and gets a single to third man
slightly slower, but short enough to be punched away square. Can't beat point, though
Akmal walks down the wicket, Chigumbura goes short, and he works him for an easy single square on the leg side
another beauty from Chigumbura. Just short of a length, Misbah is looking to run it to third man, but is beaten by the straightening of the delivery
this one keeps coming with the angle and he steers it to third man for one
length ball, pushed back to the bowler
length ball around off, pushed back to the bowler
just short of a length, and he runs it down to third man for a single
he has premeditated the scoop shot, and Masakadza bowls short and wide of off, and he has to get back up and defend this to off
pushes this down to long-on for one
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off for one
slower ball, around off, defended to cover
nicely played wide of long-off for a couple. had to beat Taylor at extra cover, which he did by hitting to his right
slower ball, defended to the right of Masakadza, who doesn't make it, but Chigumbura runs across from midwicket to prevent one
Misbah walks down and across to counter that away movement, Chigumbura digs this one in, and strays down the leg side
steered to third man for a single
Akmal moves across too, making Chigumbura go short, and then glances it fine of fine leg
length ball outside off, defended from the crease
full, on middle, defended back to the bowler
watches him come down the track, bowls short of a length, defended
length ball, on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
cut away powerfully to deep cover for one
length ball, outside driven to long-off for one
slower ball, around off, pushed back to the bowler
right forward to defend another accurate delivery
short of a length, no room, pushed to point
this one is on middle and leg, and he drives it down to long-on for one
short of a length, wide of off, played with an open face, can't beat point
full, on the pads, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, into the body, pushed to midiwcket
cut away powerfully, for a single to deep point
length ball outside off, Misbah defends, probably wants to see Elton off
another push back to the bowler. Chigumbura finishes 10 overs for 31 and a wicket
short and wide, tries the big whiplash cut, makes no connection
length ball, middle and off, pushed to long-on for one
Misbah slog-sweeps! He usually connects superbly with these. It's a length ball, angling in, and he gets down on a knee to send this crashing into boundary boards at midwicket
pushed to point with an open face
short and wide, and Misbah cuts it powerfully past point. You can hear Akmal say "Kya baat hai" [loosely translated to: what a shot]
full, on the pads, flicked away for a single that will bring an efficient fifty
flat, on the pads, pushed down the ground, can't beat an alert Chigumbura at straight midwicket
this is pushed wide of midwicket for one
defends this off the front foot, back to the bowler
angling in again, closes the face again, gets another single
Misbah presses forward, Price bowls flat, Misbah rocks back to flick it away for a single
Akmal commits forward, Price fires this into the pads, gets a dot through
full on the pads, worked around the corner for one
Akmal leaves his crease to push this wide of Chigumbura at midwicket, who makes a diving save, but by then they have decided against the single
down the track again, gets a single to long-on
pushed to the right of midwicket, but they aren't risking anything with Chigumbura
too full, and driven down to long-on for one
this is tossed up outside off and driven to long-off for another single
flat, on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one
flighted, overpitched, but slower through the air, Misbah doesn't find the pace to work with and ends up working it back to Price

Misbah has one of his famous brain freeze movements. Tries the reverse sweep. Not the subtle one where you change the bat face at the last movement. He jumps across the crease, almost as if playing a switch hit, and then changes stance. Price bowls full and straight, beats the bat, and hits him dead in front
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
another push down the ground, this time for a single to long-on
fired down the leg side, not called wide. Adnan must have got something on it
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
driven with an open face, but they have an extra man on the cover ring for the new batsman
full, middle and leg, driven to midwicket
full, outside off, driven to long-on for one
makes room and drives with an open face, for Umar there is an extra man deep on the off side, and he gets an easy single
nice flight outside off, turns in sharply, Umar plays with soft hands, with an open face, takes the single
driven with the turn, off the inside half of the bat, towards square leg. Three men inside the circle on the leg side
flighted outside off, Adnan is drawn forward to defend
Adnan gets the better of the tight leg-side field by reverse-paddling this fine of Price at short third man. He played this shot really well in the Test too
they are picking on Price there! This time Umar plays the late-cut from in front of stumps, and beats Price on the right
drives down the ground, but Lamb makes a full-length dive to his left to prevent a single
nicely flighted outside off, gets a bit of dip, driven down to long-off for a single
a touch too short, and he has cut this to the right of deep point, and immediately calls for two - "dukka" he calls it in, in Punjabi
driven to long-off for one now
turning into the pads, turned away to short fine leg
worked away to short fine again, and Umar sends Adnan back again
driven to long-on, wide of the diving Utseya, who has bowled out his 10 overs for 52 runs
flighted around off, pushed to long-off for another single
full and flat, into the pads, worked away for a single to square leg
worked away off the pads again, another single
tossed up outside off now, defended with an open face
looks to drive this through the covers, but the sharp turn has him hitting it back to the bowler
more sharp turn in, hits the pads, but they sneak in a leg-bye

a wicket first ball for Mpofu Khan! He digs this in short, not much venom behind it, and Umar goes for the pull, only managing to hit it as far as midwicket's throat. Not the greatest wicket Mpofu has got, but a big one in the context of this game. Powerplay will be taken next over, and they have sent back the dangerous Umar
and beats his outside edge right away. Tanvir drives away from the body, the ball holds its line, beats the edge
short of a length, angling in, defended back to the bowler
length ball, middle and off, defended back to Mpofu
slower ball on middle and off, Tanvir comes forward and defends with an open face
length ball, middle and off, no room, pushed back - and what do have? A wicket-maiden!
fired into the pads, no room, can't beat square leg
too straight, wide down the leg side
middle and leg, no pace on this one, worked to square leg
fires this one down again, another wide
swept away, between square leg and short fine leg - the two deep men on the on side are deep square and deep midwicket, they might need a deep backward square
full on middle and off, driven to long-off for a single
length ball, on the pads, worked away past square leg for a single
shapes up to reverse early, Price bowls full and straight, he takes a single to short third man
length ball, middle and leg, worked between deep square and deep midwicket for a couple
runs this square with an open face
slower ball, on off, opens the face, takes the single
Adanan tries to create his own width by backing away. Mpofu goes short and into him, cramping him, beating his attempt
and again Adnan makes room and charges at Mpofu, who bounces him now, over the stumps. Two dots in a row
Adnan makes room again, Mpofu bowls an offcutter to cramp him up and sneak in another dot ball
Tanvir, though, can hit a few clean ones. This is full on the pads, in his swinging arc, and Tanvir slog-sweeps this even through there are two men in the deep on the on side
full and straight, driven past him for a single to mid-off
low full toss, Adnan clears the front leg to sweep, but finds midwicket
charges at price, who follows him with the angle, cramping him up. Only a single to long-off
full and straight, near yorker, not letting him get under it, the thick edge gets him a single
Adnan tries the sweep again, but gets just the single to square leg
he keeps bowling short into the body with a strong leg-side field. This time Akmal is less ambitious and settles for the single to deep midwicket as opposed to trying to hit it through the off side
lovely yorker as he sees Tanvir make room. No room at all, no length to get under
this is slightly short of being a yorker, Tanvir hits it down the ground, but the long-on comes around to keep them down to one

Adnan finally manages to make room and hit this through the off side. Mpofu stays with his plan of bowling into the body, Adnan has missed too often to not get the timing right this time. Pierces the gap between cover and extra cover
back to full and straight on the stumps, Adnan digs it out for a single
slower one, short, smashed across the line to deep midwicket for a couple
Akmal gives him the charge, can't beat extra cover, gets just the single
full, near yorker, Tanvir can't get under it, but Sibanda fumbles at long-on to let them come back for two
full again, outside off, driven down to long-on. Good length again, not letting Tanvir get under it

tries the trusted big reverse-sweep, Price stays full and straight, and he top-edges this low full toss to point. Second wicket for Price, both off reverse-sweeps. Says something about him: he makes you do these low-percentage things
swept from outside leg, for a single to short fine
another flat and full delivery, can't get elevation with those, just the single into the on side

inn2.comm: good start, short of a length, middle and off, slight seam away, beats the bat
this starts straighter so easy for Sibanda to cover the movement away, and he pushes this to mid-off
too straight, actually down the pads, and Sibanda plays the pick-up, and the fine leg is way too square. A long leg actually
better, much better, shorter of a driving length, and then the awkward seam/off-cut he gets from middle and leg. Beats the edge again
fuller, starts outside off, shoulders arms to that one
and goes wide of the crease, gets Sibanda playing for the angle, and then cuts it away. The outside edge stands beaten again
angled across him, and Chibhabha shoulders arms to it
short of a length, around off, defended off the back foot
angled away again, Chibhabha goes chasing half-heartedly. Beaten
covers the line well this time and dabs this to square third man for one
left alone outside off as this is angling further away
extra bounce for Junaid as he beats Sibanda on this attempted cut. Adnan fails to collect it cleanly, parrying it to Younis at first slip
Tanvir continues round the wicket, and bowls another beaut. Angles in, Chibhabha has to play at it, and then the off-cut takes it away, beating the edge
this is fuller, closer to off, he covers the line, and then plays it with an open face

Too good. Simply too good. Can't do too much about these deliveries. Would have got some of the greats of the game out. He goes wide of the crease, pitches this short of a length, on middle and off, Chibhabha plays the angle, and then the off-cut comes into the play. It moves away slightly, hits the top of off. Just doff your hat, and walk off, Justice
and again he manages it to leave the batsman after angling it in. Beaten again
fuller, now, but moving slightly away after pitching off, Masakadza moves across to cover the movement, and defends
length ball, angling in this time, Masakadza defends off the front foot
starts outside off, angles away harmlessly, left alone

there's Sibanda's obsessive compulsive pull to a short-of-a-length delivery. He has been out to five such deliveries in this summer already. This one, though, is hit sweetly over mid-on. He admires the shot
this is a genuine short pullable delivery, and Sibanda swivels as he does so over midwicket. What a sight when he pulls them off
works this length ball wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, on the pads, misses on the flick, is hit on the thigh pad
length ball on the pads, pushed back to the bowler
Tanvir gets it to straighten from round the stumps again, but this is wide outside off so Sibanda can let it go
now that's another beauty! Sibanda moves forward to cover the movement, and punches this length delivery between the bowler and mid-off. No follow-through. Just the pose for the photographers
angling well down the leg side, but he can't get bat on it. Hit on the pad
short of a length, just the angle in this time, defended solidly towards cover
into the pads again, but this one gets a touch big, he will take the leg-bye
no movement away this time, defended watchfully back to Tanvir
not off the first ball, this angles in, and is pushed to cover
short of a length, around off, plays with an open face, runs this past slip for one
slower ball, but it is also a half-volley on the pads, and he checks the shot, and then drives it powerfully between the bowler and mid-on
short of a length, around off, punched to cover
short, into the body, nicely rolls the wrists on it to get a single to long leg
short and well down the leg side, big wide
placed into the on side, wide of deep square, and with soft hands. They rush back for the second and make it despite a direct hit from the deep
a gentle length ball down the leg side, and he escapes a wide through a brush on the pad
short and wide, Masakadza tries the late-cut, and ends up hitting inside the line
and Masakadza goes driving away from the body again, and once again ends up swinging inside the line
angled in, holding its line, left alone by Masakadza as this pitches wide enough outside off
lovely punch on the up, stands up, and meets the ball on the top of the bounce, hitting it past cover
angling into the pads, worked away for a single
short and flat, punched back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
turning into the pads, guided to short fine leg
big shout for lbw as Sibanda plays across the line after getting a big stride in. Touch and go on whether it hit him inside the line of off
turning well down the leg side, called a wide
the doosra, but too short, and is punched back to Ajmal
turning into the pads, deflected away for a single
short of a length, angling into off, pushed towards point
big wide down the leg side, Adnan makes a good diving collection
this one holds its line outside off, Sibanda is well forward to defend
misses out on a gift down the pads, is hit on the edge of the thigh pad. How many times have we seen balls hit that area and roll on to the stumps?
appeal for lbw, but he has bowled this from the edge of the crease and it hasn't straightened. So it's clearly going down
tries the big drive, hits it with the inside half of the bat, towards mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
the doosra, and Masakadza recovers well after shaping up to hit this to leg. Ends up defending to short midwicket
flat outside off, driven off the back foot, and allowed through by a lazy dive at point by Cheema
flighted outside off, defended back
the doosra again, just holds its line, punched to cover
gives this a bit of air, he waits for it to turn, and defends to midwicket
another doosra, too short, and pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, around off, defended to cover
big appeal for lbw, as this hurries onto Sibanda after pitching just outside off. It looks adjacent as far as the line goes, but the bounce is taking it over. They take a leg-bye
more misfielding, at midwicket where Younis is wrong-footed by the slight turn away from him
length ball outside off, and he lets it be
another leave outside off, despite the angle in towards the batsman
short of a length, angling in towards top of off, defended to cover. A good accurate start for Cheema
hit to Umar at midwicket, who fumbles when looking for a quick throw. Adnand says, "Pehle ball phad, achha?" [First get hold of the ball, okay?]
driven to long-on for one

missed run-out. Poor fielding all around. Malik fumbles deep in the on side, which makes them go for the second. However, the throw is accurate, and sure to catch them short, but Hafeez doesn't collect it properly before removing the bails. What did Adnan say two balls ago, Hafeez?
helped away past midwicket for one
the straighter one, punched back to the bowler
this one he can't work away wide of midwicket
runs this off the face of the bat for a single behind the wicket
short, into the body, tips and runs. Hasn't gone too far on the on side, but they steal the single
looks to take another sharp single, but has hit it a touch too sweetly to point
sweetly timed again, driven on the up, but can't beat Malik at cover
oh this is a lovely stroke. It's a similar length ball outside ball but this time he makes sure he places it to the right of cover. On the up. High elbow. Pose held for 10 seconds
looks to take a single behind square, but has dabbed it too fine and too close to the keeper

Hafeez! Hafeez looks innocuous when compared to Ajmal, but he is also getting them wickets! Masakadza moves too far across and tries to play this offbreak square as opposed to down the ground. Misses, and is hit in front of middle. Anybody's guess if this would have hit leg, but by moving across and looking to play across the line, he has made it look much worse
drives this down to long-on for one
another lbw appeal, but this one is turning down the leg side
flat offbreak around off, pushed back to Hafeez
tossed up outside off, defended back to the bowler
driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, angling towards off, punched to mid-on
similar length, short of what you can drive, defended with an open face
punched off the back foot, nice cracking sound as he hits it, but finds cover-point
left alone outside off as this one holds its line after pitching wide enough
accurate again, around off, angling in, defended to mid-on
length ball now, just outside off, pushed to cover
paddles this offbreak to fine leg for a single
flighted outside off, hit back to the bowler
another paddle-sweep, another single
full, on the pads, hit back to the bowler
flicked to midwicket, Umar Akmal is alert there
too full on the pads, swept away for a single
half-edge-half-dab... it's actually more of an edge, the toe end even as he looks to run this fine. It does go fine eventually, beating third man
runs this down to third man for a single, much more in control of this
another shot with an open face, but finds point this time
angling into the pads, worked away nicely for a single
half-volley on the pads, hit straight to mid-on, but Junaid Khan is caught napping there
runs this shortish delivery past point for a single
appeal for lbw again, but Taylor has got his pad well outside off as he defends
worked away off middle and leg, gets a single to deep backward square
flighted outside off, pushed back to the bowler

flatter, hit back to the bowler, and Adnan follows the Moin Khan school of keeping by shouting "Yourself". Is there any keeper in Pakistan who doesn't say "yourself" when the ball is hit back to the bowler
whipped away off the pads for a single
turning into the pads, he closes the bat face, but is too early into the shot, and is hit on the pad
gets on his toes, rides the bounce, and punches this to sweeper-cover for a single
Taylor moves across, covers the angle, pushes this to mid-on
nicely punched off the back foot, but straight to cover
overpitched outside off, and like Hafeez earlier in the day, Taylor keeps finding fielders. This time it's cover
wide outside off, left alone, not wide enough to be called a wide
looks to pinch a single after having dabbed it straight to pint. The pressure is showing on Taylor. Sent back in time, though
pushed to midwicket, and Adnan goes, "Yourself Umar", who is fielding at midwicket
Sibanda beaten on the sweep, but he has got outside the line of off
flighted around off, defended towards midwicket
more flight, another forward-defensive
Sibanda plays another forward-defensive, not finding those singles as often as he would want to
driven to long-on for a single this time

and Sibanda welcomes his back with a dismissive pull shot over midwicket. He was on the front foot but transferred the weight well while playing the shot. Fifty comes up for him. Unlike Younis and Misbah, though, he will want to make this a big one
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
Taylor likes pace on ball too, runs this down to third man for a single
yorker outside off, Sibanda gets the toe end of the bat on it, takes a single just wide of the keeper
and he tests Adnan straight away with a yorker. he collects it without any obvious show of pain
looks to run this down to third man, is almost done in by the angle. The inside edge eludes the stumps, though
comes down the track and pushes this flat delivery to long-on, to the left of the fielder, and they come back for two
long hop, puled to deep midwicket for one
pushed to long-on for another single
fullish outside off, pushed with an open face
swept away for a single, all along the ground
turning into the pads, worked away around the corner
low full toss on the pads, clipped wide of deep backward square, comes back for two
the obsessive compulsive pull! With men in the deep on the on side! In the air! However, he has connected well, and it falls short of deep midwicket
pushed to cover, just short of driving length
aha, lovely shot. Gets the driving length this time, and he goes inside-out, chipping this over extra cover. Always a good-looking shot when you go over extra
low full toss now, pushed to long-on for a single
another low full toss, driven down to long-on for a single
back-cuts this flat offbreak for a single to deep point
Taylor chips down the track and pads this away after being beaten in the flight
sweeps this low full toss to long leg
quick offbreak, defended back to Hafeez
full on the pads, can't get is past Umar at midwicket
length ball outside off, pushed back to him. Hafeez has hurried through this over
turned away into the leg side, with the turn, for a single
swept away powerfully, lovely timing, but in the air, bouncing just short of Malik at deep midwicket, who does really well to keep this in. This was monstrously hit
driven inside out, wide of cover for a single
two balls after we praised Malik, he over-runs this sweep shot, perhaps because there is no Kamran to tell him "ghoomaygi [will turn]. The fumble costs them the second
doosra, but too short, and cut away for an easy single
tossed up outside off, defended towards Misbah at cover
sees him chip down the track and fires in a yorker on middle and leg. Sibanda does well to keep this out
big sweep from outside off, more of a hoick, manages to keep it down
closes the face on this offbreak, can't get it past midwicket
Taylor is partial to the chip shot, comes down the track, and plays an immaculate chip over midwicket to come back for two
worked off the pads, with the turn, gets the single
fired down the leg side, easy call for a wide
that wide has cost them seven! Sibanda is reaching for the next gear too. This is the second slog-sweep he has tried this over, but this time he has connected sweetly. Clears deep midwicket with ease
nicely steered away to third man for a single
picks the slower ball, tries the big sweep, but it squeezes under his bat

What a way to go! Sibanda is caught-and-bowled and bat-pad! To the insult he has added an injury! He gives this length ball some humpty, and the thick inside edge hits his back pad, and it lobs off to Cheema who delightfully completes a simple catch. Sibanda is on the ground, that ball might have hit his knee. He has to be helped off the pitch. The medical support carry his gloves and pads for him as he hobbles off
nice yorker to welcome Taibu, just outside off, not missing by much
length ball outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched square to point
flat offbreak outside off, pushed to cover
full outside off, driven to long-on for one

History 101, where are you? Near run-out. Pushed to cover. Taylor wants one. Taibu doesn't. Sent back. Taylor has to dive. Hafeez seems to have disturbed the stumps without collecting the ball for the second time today. The replays are not conclusive, but it's possible the ball might have hit the stump before Hafeez's hand did so. Benefit of doubt to the batsman, who was definitely out of the crease when the bails came off
defended with an open face, past point
helped away with the turn, past square leg
overspinner outside off, defended back to the bowler
angling into the pads, helped away for another single
slower ball outside off, pushed between cover and point for a single
length ball, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, looks to run this fine, but ends up playing it to point
flicked away from in front of the stumps, gets a single
length ball outside off, driven to cover
chips down the track and pushes this back to the bowler
low full toss, hit to deep midwicket for one
guides this fine behind square for one
the straighter one, pushed back to the bowler
length ball, offbreak, pushed to long-on for a single
pushes this to cover, end of Hafeez's 10 who has done a good job with 1 for 38
plays around the front pad, guides it past square leg for a single
tossed up outside off, defended back to the bowler
Taibu reverse-sweeps, to the right of short third, and to the left of deep point. So they can take an easy two
presses forward, quickly rocks back, cuts a length ball to the right of deep point this time
fuller delivery, defended back to the bowler
back-cuts this length ball, but can't beat short third an this time
offbreak on middle and leg, worked away with the turn for a single
driven against the turn, but can't beat cover
this one turns into the pads, he works it around the corner, but straight to short fine
short of a length, pushed past point for one
chips down the track, gets close to the pitch of the ball, and then chips it over midwicket. Two good-looking runs
fired down the pads, tries the big sweep, gets a top edge, but it doesn't carry to short fine leg
turning into the pads, worked between square leg and midwicket for a single
straighter one outside off, pushed to cover
tries the sweep, misses, hit on the pad, but it is turning down the leg side
swept away to deep backward square, all along the ground
defended to cover, Misbah charges in sharply

big shout for lbw as Taibu fails to connect on the reverse-sweep. Given not-out. Could have got outside the lien of off. I can't conclusively say because I haven't seen a replay. All I know is Ajmal is not impressed, but the umpire pats his back as he hands him over his cap
flighted around off, hit back to Malik
turning into the pads, misses out on an easy single as he pushes this to midwicket
full on middle and off, driven to long-on for a single
full on the pads, driven to deep midwicket for a single
swept away to deep backward square for another single
chipped into the on side, between the two deep men on the on side, and they come back for the second
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover for one
length ball, outside off, pushed to point
and for the first time he bowls the famous slower ball. Taibu mis-hits this back to Tanvir
angled into the pads, pushed to midwicket
full toss, Taibu seems a but surprised, pushes this to mid-off for a single
slower ball again, dropped towards midwicket, still can't get the single
the slog-sweep, and good for Taibu that he hasn't hit it too well. It bounces short of long-on
Taylor chips again, but has he hit it too well? No he hasn't. It drops short of long-on, and Junaid's lazy wrjk gets them the second
dropped by the bowler! Taylor tries the powerful hit down the ground, gets too close to the pitch of the ball, hence doesn;t get the elevation, but Malik has let it through
no chance for any fielder here, Taibu connects this slog-sweep sweetly, well over wide long-on
drops and runs this time, just around the corner
driven to long-on for a single
angling in towards off, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, angling towards middle and leg, pushed straight to midwicket
driven to mid-off for a single
short, gets a bit big, Taibu rides the bounce, then opens the face, gets the single
more ordinary fielding, slower ball, pushed towards deep midwicket, Cheema is slow to get down on it and then takes an age to make up his mind where to throw it
played with soft hands, but ends up doing so straight back to the bowler. Was surely looking for the tip-and-run
plays the back-cut, and Tanvir makes a diving save at short third man less than a minute after finishing an over
doosra, reads it off the pitch, guides it past point
another single as he runs this off the face of the bat
looks to turn this to leg, is hit on the pad outside the line of off
doosra, sharp one, Taylor doesn't pick it, plays the big sweep, the top edge goes over the keeper's gloves for four
well forward to defend this back to the bowler
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
slower ball, just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
full, into the pads, cramps him up for room, pushed straight to midiwcket
this one nips back in from outside off, takes the inside edge, onto the pad. Four dots in a row
the slower ball, short outside off, punched away to deep cover for a single
early into the shot, driven with an open face, uppish too, but between point and cover
doosra from Ajmal, defended off the front foot
sharp and quick offbreak, Taylor is late into an attempt to work it to leg

doosra, too quick, too short, reads it from the pitch, guides it past short third man, brings up his fifty. Important innings. He has not panicked, even when hitting straight to fielders for a long time. A slight acknowledgement to the healthy applause, and back to work
defended back to Ajmal,with the turn
doosra, but he has tended to drag them down, and Taibu has cut this to deep point for a single
nicely swept away, from in front of middle, placed between short fine and deep backward square
Taibu walks down the track, Cheema stays accurate, no room, defended to cover
wide down the leg side... no he got some glove to it, and Adnan makes an acrobatic save. Two men walk up to pat his back
Slower ball! Taibu is gone. He clears the front leg and tries the big slog. Done in by the slowness. The top edge rests with Younis at long-off. Will this turn the match towards Pakistan?
flicked away off the pads for a single
gets a welcome drink of a full toss on the pads, and gets off the mark with a clip into the leg side
slower ball, driven to long-on for a single
full delivery, swings in late, Taylor keeps it out
this one tails the other way, but ends up being a full toss wide of off, and Taylor's open-face drive beats point to get him four important runs
Taylor stands on leg and tries to hit it through the covers... misses a length ball completely
length ball, angling in, Taylor gets the inside half of the bat back to the bowler
lovely shot, inside-out drive, all along the ground, past cover, Taylor could end up with a special innings here if he sees them through
late swing into the pads, Taylor fails to make contact as he tries to work this to leg
Waller has played a superb shot first ball. He knows the field really well here. Gets inside the line of a slower ball, and plays the little pick-up over short fine

this is not smart bowling at all... Tanvir bowls full and wide with the third man up! And Waller is showing a real calm head. Doesn't try to hit this hard. Just opens the face. Between point and short third
big, big shout for lbw as Waller walks across the stumps and misses. He seems to have just gout outside the lien, and also it hits him above the knee roll
short outside off, he has walked down the track and misses on the back-cut
slower ball, overpitched, clipped away to square leg for a single
short of a length, outside off, dropped into the covers for a single to make it 10 off the over. Asking rate now: 7.57
starts off with the doosra, calmly deflected to leg for a single
Ajmal! Doosra, sharp spitting doosra. Short of a length, outside off, spins away, Waller doesn't know what to do. Leaves the bat handing. The leading edge is taken. Lobs off to cover-point
another doosra, worked square on the on side for one
another doosra, the offbreak will be the variation! Just outside off, turning away, left alone
another doosra, this was slightly short and he went for the cut. The extra bounce beat him here
offbreak finally, worked around the corner for a single
length ball, angling in to off, defended to cover
tires the yorker, but has sprayed it down the leg side
slower ball, but it lands up as a half-volley wide outside off, and Chigumbura murders this between mid-off and extra cover. Past 200 for Zimbabwe. Fewer than 50 required
short of a length, straight, over the top of off, pushed to point
length ball outside off, hit powerfully but straight to cover-point
length ball into the pads, driven down to long-on for a single
Taylor is doing it really nicely... not panicking, playing percentage shots, still getting the runs. Again he chips a length ball over midwicket, which ends wide enough of long-on to get them two
doosra again, pitched middle and leg, defended back to Ajmal
another doosra, this time he picks it and punches it square, Umar Akmal misfields, lets them get the second too
another doosra, pitches leg, worked away to leg
Huge shout for lbw! Gould says not out, and rightly so. This has hit him dead in front, but the extra bounce means it is bouncing well over
perhaps the first low-percentage shot from Taylor. Then again, given the number of doosras, perhaps not. Plays the reverse-sweep, between point and short third. Perfectly placed

they take the sharp single to short fine leg, Junaid hits the stumps direct, but he has got in by inches. More frames per second, and we would have split more hairs. With what we have, though, Elton is in

full outside off, driven just wide of long-off, and Chigumbura is running like a champion here. Younis Khan throws from long-off, and Chigumbura has covered about two yards through this dive to get in
Gunner Gould you beauty! He is really alert. Calls this a no-ball because the short fine leg has wandered outside the circle. Cheema is the man. This is a yorker on the pads, concedes a leg-bye
another yorker, this one is on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Chigumbura walks across the stumps to try and get this wide of short fine, but doesn't get enough bat on this, and gets just the single
gentle gift of a full toss on the pads, angling in, and Taylor has flicked this past short fine. He is not having to take risks here, and is playing a real beauty
just as I said that Taylor slogs to a short of a length delivery outside off. Beaten by the bounce
near run-out, full on the pads, hit straight to midwicket, sends Chigumbura back who is so far up the pitch he gives up. The throw misses, though
sharp offbreak, guides past point for a single
doosra, Taylor tries to loft this over leg, is beaten because he is playing for the offbreak
another doosra, Taylor jumps out of the crease, and pads this away
sweeps this one powerfully, this just held its line, and he keeps the sweep down, gets a single to fine leg
another doosra, picks it off the pitch, plays with soft hands for a single to cover
the regulation offbreak, Taylor tries the sweep, is beaten by the extra bounce
bowls length ball first up, and Chigumbura has absolutely slapped it across its face. Powerful swipe past cover. No fielder moved. Neither long-off nor cover had a chance
slower ball, length again, and Chigumbura goes after it again, the mis-hit lands short of deep cover
length again, another slower ball, and Taylor has swept it in front of square. Malik does well at deep midwicket, but can't keep them from taking the second.

Cheema strikes! What a time for the deutant to take this wicket! Taylor has left Zimbabwe 200 metres short of finishing this half-marathon. This is a length ball again, Taylor looks to slog it, but it perhaps surprised by the quickness of it off the surface. Top-edges. Tanvir runs to his left from midwicket to complete a simple catch. Over to you Elton

why is he bowling length? Heaved away all along the ground, but Malik from deep midwicket runs to his right and makes a desperate lunge to keep this from reaching the boundary. Could this be a match-winning lunge?
he goes for the single, steering this widish delivery to third man
full toss outside off, driven with an open face, wide of deep cover, gets two runs, keeps the strike
low full toss, Chigumbura goes across its line, looking for the biog slog, doesn't connect at all. Advantage Pakistan
another low full toss, Elton can't get under it, gets just the single to cover. Applause from Pakistan's support staff
another full toss, Lamb hits it square, but finds point, Six feet either side, and he would have got four

another low full toss, and Chigumbura goes down the ground. The mis-hit lands short of long-off, Umar Akmal fumbles there, but makes up for it with a flat throw at the striker's end to get Chigumbura out

He has taken guard at sixth stump outside off, he is going to slog it to leg. Gets the length ball too, but can't time it well enough to clear the midwicket boundary. Heartbreak for Zimbabwe, bullet bitten by Pakistan
